q: What anchors are used for flood-barrier systems?
a: 316 stainless steel expansion bolts or chemical anchors rated ≥1,200 lb pull-out. Chemical anchors are preferred for coastal zones due to corrosion resistance.

q: How deep should anchors be embedded?
a: Minimum 2.75 inches into concrete or 1.5 inches into CMU grout cores per ASTM E488. Depth ensures the system handles 4 psi water pressure on 4-ft panel height.
Only if torque tests confirm holding strength ≥90 % of spec. Otherwise re-drill and epoxy new anchors.

q: How do you seal anchor points?
a: After install, we inject marine-grade polyurethane and cap with removable stainless plugs to prevent corrosion and tripping hazards.

q: What torque should bolts be tightened to?
a: 35–40 ft-lb for ¼-inch bolts, 50–55 ft-lb for ⅜-inch. Over-tightening can deform aluminum tracks.
